headline: If you read this 1000 years from MAY 23 2025…
description: A digital bottle tossed into the future’s ocean. A reflection on time, memory, and what it means to leave a mark that might matter in a thousand years.
timeFelt: Felt like writing through the fog of time, hopeful but unsure if the voice would carry across centuries.
whyItMatters: This is a reminder that digital memory is fallible and yet sacred, that to write with the hope of being remembered is one of the oldest and most human acts.
articleExcerpt: Maybe you can’t even read English anymore. Maybe this file is all that survived. But I wanted you to know—I tried.
sourceFragments: “1000 years from now” — a deliberate frame of unimaginable duration.
“Some part of me will still be here, maybe.”
“It’s a note to no one, a gospel to a maybe.”
